“I visited Rohingya refugee camps. Here are my takeaways:”https://twitter.com/i/moments/933089456042672128 …
I'm calling for humanitarian access, freedom of movement & citizenship for Rohingya, safe repatriation, full investigation & accountability.pic.twitter.com/5UAPMk4Hwj

Met with the Rohingya community in the Muslim quarter in the city of Sittwe. Five years ago, the Burmese government turned the neighborhood into a closed ghetto with barriers and police checkpoints. I can't believe this is happening in 2017.pic.twitter.com/3zqNQ8wYS9

Spoke with Bangladesh Prime Minister @sheikhhasina and thanked her for the humanitarian access she is providing to Rohingya. We discussed how we can work together to respond to this crisis.pic.twitter.com/ItsblFvEFJ
These Rohingya children are inspiring. They are singing, drawing, and making kites at a refugee camp.pic.twitter.com/NOHOQHQMyK
This brave young Rohingya boy showed me drawings he made of the Burmese military trucks and helicopters that attacked his village.pic.twitter.com/rKdTZ7Vuri

These Rohingya women told me powerful stories about the persecution they faced and showed me their burn scars. The tragedy is unimaginable. It’s imperative that we work with international partners to address this urgent crisis.pic.twitter.com/ZkxdI9wurv

Met a nurse practitioner from Salem, Oregon, who is doing inspiring work providing medical care to Rohingya women and children who suffered terrible injuries as they escaped their homes.pic.twitter.com/Vdy4ebZMtq
I met with Rohingya refugees in a camp in Bangladesh. The man I'm talking to in the picture walked 7 days to reach a border crossing.pic.twitter.com/lNKEWEH4jq

I just concluded a fact-finding mission to Bangladesh and Burma. Our goal was to find out what would be most helpful in resolving the refugee and humanitarian crisis following the shameful persecution of the Rohingya people.pic.twitter.com/wsl3sCvEvw
